headline.main: Oral HPV More Common in Men Than Women

docs.snippet: About one in 15 Americans is infected with oral human papillomavirus, a sexually transmitted virus that causes throat cancers, and the disease is especially common among men, new research shows....

headline.main: Davos Potpourri, Day 2: The Party Never Ends

docs.snippet: To understand the World Economic Forum, you have to take in the first-hand accounts of the snowbound elite, as related through a barrage of Twitter messages from reporters and others involved in the conference....
docs.abstract: To understand the World Economic Forum, you have to take in the first-hand accounts of the snowbound elite, as related through a barrage of Twitter messages from reporters and others involved in the conference.

headline.main: Davos Potpourri, Day 2: The Party Never Ends

docs.snippet: To understand the World Economic Forum, you have to take in the first-hand accounts of the snowbound elite, as related through a barrage of Twitter messages from reporters and others involved in the conference....
docs.abstract: To understand the World Economic Forum, you have to take in the first-hand accounts of the snowbound elite, as related through a barrage of Twitter messages from reporters and others involved in the conference.
docs.lead_paragraph: The World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, rolled on Thursday, with news-making speeches by Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain, Bill Gates and Archbishop Desmond Tutu, among others. Mr. Cameron proposed a "coalition of the willing" to open up global free trade, Mr. Gates pledged $750 million to a struggling AIDS fund, and Archbishop Tutu told the downtrodden financiers in attendance: "Each one of us is made for goodness, even bankers."

docs.snippet: The founder of China Labor Watch speaks about labor conditions at Foxconn, which has some of the world's biggest factories, and at other electronics factories....

headline.main: Questions for Li Qiang of China Labor Watch

docs.snippet: The founder of China Labor Watch speaks about labor conditions at Foxconn, which has some of the world's biggest factories, and at other electronics factories....
docs.abstract: The founder of China Labor Watch speaks about labor conditions at Foxconn, which has some of the world's biggest factories, and at other electronics factories.
docs.lead_paragraph: Li Qiang, 39, is the founder of China Labor Watch, a nonprofit group in New York City that seeks to improve labor conditions in China. In the late 1990s, while studying law in southwest China's Sichuan Province, he began supporting striking workers and taxi drivers. Later, he moved south, to China's biggest factory zones near Shenzhen. He worked at several electronics, toy and shoe factories, where he investigated labor conditions, and tried to expose what he saw as unjust and inhumane conditions.

docs.snippet: The main horse who plays Joey in "War Horse" never finished higher than fifth in his racing career....
docs.abstract: The main horse who plays Joey in "War Horse" never finished higher than fifth in his racing career.

docs.snippet: The main horse who plays Joey in "War Horse" never finished higher than fifth in his racing career....
docs.abstract: The main horse who plays Joey in "War Horse" never finished higher than fifth in his racing career.
docs.lead_paragraph: We've heard about Uggie in "The Artist" and Cosmo in "Beginners," and about their brewing rivalry, fueled by an unrepentant Christopher Plummer. But until now we didn't know that you can judge a horse by its acting. From our Sports pages we learn that Finders Key, the main horse who plays Joey in the best-picture nominee "War Horse" (and is billed in the credits as Finder), "is so versatile that in an early scene, in an inventive twist, he plays his own dam giving birth to Joey." The thoroughbred gelding never finished higher than fifth at the Los Alamitos Race Course, but he has had an impressive screen career -- you may remember he also played Seabiscuit -- that has drawn plaudits. "Often in horse movies, as a horseman, you cringe at a couple of scenes because they are either unrealistic or simply incorrect," Alex Brown, a veteran exercise rider, has written elsewhere, adding, "In 'War Horse,' Joey's role was brilliant."Read more »
